comments:
Build ID: eclipse.buildId=I20070625-1500

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Open help -> software updates -> find and install
2. make an archive site with cdt-master-4.0.1-I200708290101.zip
3. xlC feature is missing.

same is true of yesterday's.
It worked on cdt-master-4.0.0-I200706261300.zip


More information:
Doug says it's physically there.

Error log reports:
java.io.FileNotFoundException: JAR entry features/org.eclipse.cdt.xlc.feature_4.0.1.200708290101.jar not found in C:\download\eclipse\cdt-master-4.0.1-I200708290101.zip
	at sun.net.www.protocol.jar.JarURLConnection.connect(Unknown Source)

Aha. it's looking for 4.0.1 file and the file that's in the zip is 4.0.0.   Where is that specified?

D'oh. The site.xml file that gets generated assumes all the features have the same buildVersion. That won't be generally true, or maybe it should. I'm not sure.

There two solutions, 1) hard code the version number for the features that are different and pass in the timestamp to complete the buildversion attribute for it, or 2) up version the xlc feature to 4.0.1.

Any preferences?

(In reply to comment #1)
> D'oh. The site.xml file that gets generated assumes all the features have the
> same buildVersion. That won't be generally true, or maybe it should. I'm not
> sure.
> There two solutions, 1) hard code the version number for the features that are
> different and pass in the timestamp to complete the buildversion attribute for
> it, or 2) up version the xlc feature to 4.0.1.
> Any preferences?

I will be checking in changes soon, so the plugin and feature will have to be upversioned anyway, and hence the point is moot :-)

Damn... even though the plug-ins were upversioned I forgot to upversion the feature.  It's still not in the build :-(

Where is that clown nose...

Anyway, this should be FIXED in theory now, but we'll need a new build before it shows up.

Forgot to set the target milestone...

Setting this to 4.0.1 and asking Doug for a respin...
